fields.label: HTML Block
fields.content:
Let's link up your custom domain {user:display_name}!

We'll walk you through all the steps required to link your own domain to your site. Let's get started shall we?

fields.label: Have you registered a domain name?

choices.text: Yes, I have registered a domain
choices.value: Yes, I have registered a domain

choices.text: No, I still need a domain name
choices.value: No, I still need a domain name

choices.text: No, it's a domain registered for this site!
choices.value: No, it's a domain registered for this site!

choices.text: Yes, it's a "live site" with content already being present.
choices.value: Yes, it's a "live site" with content already being present.

choices.text: Yes, but there is nothing important there, I'm ready to point it to this site!
choices.value: Yes, but there is nothing important there, I'm ready to point it to this site!

fields.description: Are you currently using this domain to host a website?

rules.value: Yes, I have registered a domain

choices.text: Via my current Top Level Domain (example: mydomain.com)
choices.value: toplevel

choices.text: Via a Subdomain (example: site.mydomain.com)

rules.value: Yes, an existing website is currently hosted on this domain

fields.label: Migration completed

rules.value: Yes, it's a "live site" with content already being present.

fields.content: {dollie_tpl_migrate_completed}

fields.label: Have you moved over your files/database via our Dollie Site Migration plugin at least once?

choices.text: Yes, I've done this successfully!
choices.value: Yes, I've done this successfully!

choices.text: No, I have not done this yet.
choices.value: No, I have not done this yet.

rules.value: Yes, it's a "live site" with content being created by my members.

fields.label: HTML Block

rules.value: Yes, I've done this successfully!

fields.content:
Great! So here's what you need to know

1. Do not worry about new content/files that were added after you have done the migration. We will get to this later.
2. Please keep the Site Migration Plugin installed and active on your current live website.
3. At a later stage during this wizard we will sync your existing content/database one final time.

fields.label: Migration Installation Instructions

rules.value: No, I have not done this yet.

fields.content:
Please do an initial content migration first!

http://wefoster.helpscoutdocs.com/article/59-migrating-your-content-with-the-wefoster-automated-site-migration-plugin

Once you are done please come back to this form and continue!

fields.label: Register Your Domain Name

rules.value: No, I still need a domain name

fields.content:
Registering a Domain

We are not selling domains directly, all our efforts go to perfecting WordPress site hosting.

If you have not registered your own domain yet, this is the time to do so! We recommend NameCheap because of their easy to use domain manager and very low prices., but you are free to choose any other domain registrar. Go ahead, register your domain and come back to this form to continue the domain setup!

choices.text: Yes, I have registered my domain!
choices.value: Yes, I have registered my domain!

rules.value: No, I still need a domain name

fields.content:
Your domain {Your Domain Name:55} was successfully connected!

Let's continue with our domain setup by configuring CloudFlare or LetsEncrypt.

fields.label: How would you like to set up your SSL certificate?

choices.text: Automatically generate a free LetsEncrypt certificate
choices.value: letsencrypt

choices.text: Use my CloudFlare account
choices.value: cloudflare

fields.description: Having a SSL certificate is crucial for any site for security and SEO. Luckily we make it extremely easy for you!

fields.label: CloudFlare Email
fields.description: The email you use to login to your CloudFlare account.

rules.value: cloudflare

fields.label: CloudFlare API Key
fields.description: See the instructions below to see how you can find your CloudFlare API key.

rules.value: cloudflare

fields.label: HTML Block

rules.value: cloudflare

fields.content:
Finding Your CloudFlare API Key

Please visit the following page to find instructions on getting your CloudFlare API key

rules.value: cloudflare

fields.label: Community Insights
fields.content:
CloudFlare Linked Succesfully!

We have successfully linked up the CloudFlae account belonging to the email {CloudFlare Email:50}

Detailed Site Analytics

Want to quickly know how your site is doing? In addition to visitor analytics, we also monitor threats and search engine crawlers. It’s traffic every site owner should understand, but most analytics services ignore!

fields.label: Your CloudFlare Zone ID
fields.description: To enable Site Analytics paste in your Zone ID in the field below. See the instructions below for more info.

fields.label: Finding Your Zone ID
fields.content:
Finding Your Domains Zone ID

  1. Login to your CloudFlare account
  2. Click on the Domain Name belonging to this site {Your Domain Name:55}
  3. Scroll down to the Domain Summary section and copy and paste the Zone ID.

fields.label: DNS Instructions
fields.content: {dollie_tpl_update_url}

fields.label: IP Details
fields.content: {dollie_tpl_link_domain}

fields.label: Did you make the required DNS change?

choices.text: Yes
choices.value: Yes

choices.text: No, I'm unsure what to do...
choices.value: No, I'm unsure what to do...

fields.label: DNS Test

rules.value: Yes

fields.content:
Great job! Now we'll just have to wait until the DNS changes take effect. This usually takes anywhere between a couple of minutes to one hour. The easiest way to check if your DNS has been updated is to go here:

DNS Check Tool

fields.label: Is your domain name pointing to your WordPress installation?

choices.text: Yes, it does!
choices.value: Yes, it does!

choices.text: No, the DNS changes do not take affect
choices.value: No, the DNS changes do not take affect

fields.description:
When you visit your custom domain URL ("yourdomain.com") does it redirect you to your site on our platform?

Sometimes you might see a SSL certificate error/warning, this means the DNS has updated and you can safely continue with the setup..

rules.value: Yes

fields.label: Let's Get Things Right

rules.value: No, the DNS changes do not take affect

fields.content:
Let's get things right!

We've written a step-by-step guide to resolve common DNS issues that in most cases will help you quickly figure out the issue. See our "Common DNS Issues and how to fix them!" article!

fields.label: Support Request

rules.value: No, I'm unsure what to do...

fields.content:
No worries , we're here to help!

Please create a support ticket so our team can assist you in making the required DNS changes. In order for us to do this, you need to give us temporary access to your CloudFlare account. Please include these details with your support ticket. Create A Support Ticket">

rules.value: Yes, it does!

fields.label: Replace URL
fields.content: {dollie_tpl_update_url}

fields.label: Does your live domain have www. in the URL?

choices.text: Yes, my site contains www. in the URL
choices.value: yes

choices.text: No, www. is not present.
choices.value: no

choices.text: I don't know...
choices.value: unknown

fields.description: When you visit your domain does it show www. in the address bar?

rules.value: unknown

fields.content:
No problemo!

The recommended domain setup these days is to remove www. from the URL. So we will continue setting up your domain without the www. prefix.

fields.label: Check Your Domain Migration
fields.content: We're now updating your domain!

fields.label: Is your site now using your custom domain?

choices.text: Yes, it does!
choices.value: Yes, it does!

choices.text: No, it still shows the temporary URL..
choices.value: No, it still shows the temporary URL..

choices.text: Yes, but my site is broken or behaving weirdly..
choices.value: Yes, but my site is broken or behaving weirdly..

fields.label: HTML Block

rules.value: Yes, but my site is broken or behaving weirdly..

fields.content:
Let's Revert Your Changes.

This can happen if you have a plugin or themes that store URLs in a weird way. Click the button below to revert your site and please create a support ticket so we our migration team can get to the bottom of this!

fields.label: HTML Block

rules.value: No, it still shows the temporary URL..

fields.content:
Please wait a few more minutes...

If you have a large database the update might take a while. Please hold on a couple of minutes and if nothing has changed please get in touch with our support team so we can look into the issue.

rules.value: Yes, it does!

fields.label: HTML Block
fields.content:
Your Domain Migration is Complete!

You're officially a migration expert now. We're incredibly proud of you!

meta.workflow_notification_subject: Your Dollie Migration Request for {Your Domain Name:19}

meta.description: Customer Clarification on the Migration Process

rules.value: Yes, I have registered a domain

meta.instructionsValue: Please update your migration request based on the instructions you have received via email from our Migration Team: {workflow_note} Once you are done please switch the status to "Complete" and press "Apply".
meta.assignee_notification_message: A new entry requires your input

meta.description: Send a notification to our team that a migration needs to be approved.
Ready to do a migration for our customers? Approve the request and get started!
meta.instructionsValue:
Ready to do a migration for our customer? Approve the request and get started! Not enough information? Reject the request and add instructions to the "Notes" field.

Note to customer:
Thanks for updating your migration! It is currently in review!
meta.assignee_notification_message: A new entry is pending your approval. Please check your Workflow Inbox.
meta.rejection_notification_subject: Dollie Migrations - Please provide us with further information about your migration
meta.rejection_notification_message: Hi {user:display_name}, Currently we are unable to start your migration because we're missing some information. Here's what our migration expert had to say: {workflow_note} Please go here to update your migration request Once we have received your updated information we'll review your migration request again. Thank you, The Dollie Migration Team
meta.approval_notification_subject: We will start the migration of {Your Domain Name:19} to our platform!
meta.approval_notification_message:
Hi {user:display_name}! We're happy to tell you that your migration to the Dollie platform is on it's way. Our team has received everything they need to move over your site and in most cases the migration will be completed within a day.

Following the status of your migration

Please visit your Dollie Customer Dashboard to see the status of your migration and directly talk to our team in case you have questions. Click here to follow your migration progress Greetings, The Dollie Migration Team

meta.description: Assign an expert to this migration
meta.instructionsValue: Please choose the migration expert for this task. Also feel free to claim it yourself if needed.
meta.assignee_notification_message: A new entry requires your input

rules.value: Yes, I have registered a domain

meta.instructionsValue: You can discuss the migration with {Assigned Migration Expert:31} if needed. Once the migration is complete please switch the status to "Complete" and press "Apply".
